Description: Facsimile of papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal document dated year 36 of Ptolemy VI, dealing with the sale of share of income from tombs at Thebes. 20 ll. of demotic and 6 ll. of Greek docket on original recto, 18 ll. on original verso (list of witnesses).
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) ((the site refers to the original in Paris))
Curator's comments: This is an early 19th century copy, the original is in the Bibliotheque National, Paris, P Bibl. Nat. 218. The BM facsimile is important as it preserves the list on the verso of the original papyrus. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "grant by Onnophris to his son Asos [...] (cf. Young, Hieroglyphics pl. 31. 32 and Brugsch. Thesaurus p. 880 and Revillout Chrest. Dem. p. 62-84)". Published in: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, pp. 114-5
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.63-4, pl.50)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (3634) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/3634)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Paper: discoloured Black ink Backed: white paper Transferred to horizontal storage 10 FEB 95 Mount Details: Portfolio: board (acidic) Portfolio: leather (deteriorated) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: C Overall Condition: B
